Dear Yulonda W Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.

Sincerely,
Dayna Lamkey, Licensing Consultant

Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.

Allegation Allegation 1:
Two youth have been engaging in sex at the facility on multiple
occasions. On 1/11/25, a separation plan went into place when
the youth were caught kissing. The youths refused to be
separated and became physical with staff who attempted to
separate them. There are now two staff on the wing but the youth
continue to be sexual with each other in front of staff.
Allegation 2:
On 01/16/2025, Youth E kissed Youth B on her neck. At the same
time Youth D kissed Youth E. Staff 4 was supervising the children
and told them to step away from the area and they did not listen
but the kissing did not continue.
Investigation Allegation 1:
Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25.
Staff 1 reported he was aware that Youth A was sneaky. He was
aware of this from things he heard and witnessed, such as her

recalled an incident that occurred on 1/10/25 at approximately
8pm. Staff 1 reported Youth B was having a hard day with another
youth and was offered a one on one to talk it out during which time
Youth B asked to go into the sensory room before bed. Staff 1
reported that he gave permission for Youth B and Youth A to go
into the sensory room together. Staff 1 reported that he was
seated at the door of the sensory room, talking with the girls and
that they were talking the entire time. Staff 1 reported that the girls
were giggling and asking him questions. Staff 1 reported that he
kept view of them laying down and that he continued conversing
with them for most of the time. Staff 1 denied witnessing Youth A
exhibiting any sexually inappropriate behaviors. He said he heard
that Youth A has said inappropriate things around other staff,
elaborating that Staff 2 said Youth A asked if he wanted his
2

“blank” sucked. Staff 1 reported he did not observe or hear the
two youth engage in any inappropriate contact including sexual
contact or statements regarding sexual contact. Staff 1 reported
that he would have heard if something was occurring due to where
he was sitting. Staff 1 denied that anything occurred out of the
ordinary while the girls were in the sensory room. Staff 1 reported
that if he heard or seen anything inappropriate, he would have told
them to stop and asked them to exit the sensory room. Staff 1
reported that Youth A has been sneaky in the past and stated that
he was not surprised about her saying sexually explicit things Staff
1 reported this in response to being asked if he was aware of any

the incident. Staff 1 reported that he personally had never had any
issues with Youth A and Youth B, so he did not anticipate having

not heard of anything going on between Youth A and Youth B
before this day. Staff 1 reported that he was aware that Youth A
had a relationship with another youth and that there was a
separation plan in place regarding those youth and that he had
heard they had broken up.

Youth C reported that girls are not allowed to have relationships

reported that she knows that girls have relationships together

another at Vista.
Youth A, consultant and MDHHS worker attempted to interview
Youth A face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25 at approximately
10am and again at approximately 1pm. Youth A refused to
participate in the interview.
Youth B, was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/15/25.
Youth B stated that she knew what inappropriate touching was but
that she did not know how to explain it, just that she knew what it
meant and declined to give an example. Youth B reported that she
did not know about anything inappropriate going on or anything
about any of the girls being in relationships with each other. Youth
B was asked if she ever engaged in touching with another youth at
Vista. Youth B stated “well yeah.” Youth B reported that staff was
there, talking to them while it was happening. Youth B reported
that the Staff did not know that they were touching each other and

Youth B reported she does not know what else they do, but then

Youth B reported that she and Youth A are not allowed on the

Staff 2, was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/15/25.
Staff 2 reported he was aware that Youth A and Youth B had been

Staff 5, staff 5 has been on medical leave and unable to be

Video Review:
Video – Sensory Room 1/10/2025
Video was viewed at the facility by MDHHS Worker and consultant
and not sent due to explicit content. Video footage shows Youth A
and Youth B in the sensory room as described in interviews. Video
shows Staff 1 seated in a chair at the doorway and Youth A and
Youth B next to one another. There is a large item in between
Staff 1 and the youth. Video shows approximately 9 minutes of
youth engaging in sexual activity including Youth B giving Youth A
oral sex as well as Youth B giving Youth A digital sex. Youth A
removes her pants down below her knees multiple times, for
several seconds each time. Staff A is observed in the footage to
intermittently speak with Youth A from the chair.
Tour:
A large item to the right of the doorway was confirmed during the
walkthrough to be a hammock and exercise ball, obstructing view
of the bean bag in which the youth were laying and sitting during

Allegation 2:

Documents reviewed:
• Incident report #2497 dated 1/16/2025 as
referenced by Staff 4 and authored by Staff 4
documents Staff 4 observing Youth D, Youth E, and

documents Staff 4 giving verbal redirection and

Analysis Allegation 1:
A violation is established regarding the first allegation. It was
reported and supported via interviews with Youth A and Youth B
that there was sexual contact between the youth. Allowing Youth
A and Youth B to be alone in a room together with limited sight
from staff did not provide for the continual needs and protection of
the youth.
Allegation 2:
8

A violation is not established for the additional allegation. It was
reported by staff and supported by youth interviews that staff
provided verbal direction to the youth which was followed. Staff
filed an incident report and a separation plan was put into place
and followed.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001262; CAP approved 10/8/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
